resources.string:
About EQally

We are the experts aiming to bring behavioral science, technology and fun together. EQally is the starting point to help people to expand and master communication tools nature and evolution provided us with.

In the world of overflow of unreliable information, we guarantee that all we offer is based on time-proven scientific research.

Our goal is to make science intelligible, easy to use through technology and to experience joyful learning. We aim to make this behavior knowledge to be globally available through our tools because the language of our emotional expressions is Universal.

EQally helps everyone to develop emotional awareness in conversations and the ability to take another person\'s perspective and learn from them.
Which universal emotion do you want to learn more about?
Which emotion did you just see?
The function of anger is to boost one\'s ability to overcome obstacles on the way to the goal. It makes us look threatening, and prepare for the fight.
Stop interference, eliminate threat to the goal

Blood rushes to upper part of the body. Face may get red. Shoulders open, making body visually bigger. Lean forward. Prolonged anger can cause amygdala hijack and also may be associated with increase of testosterone and decrease of cortisol levels.

string-array.name: Emotion_anger_cards
string-array.item: Upper lids pulled up, lower lids tighten and pulled up
Margin of the lips pulled in, sometimes lips tight

resources.string: The most likely evolutionary function of disgust was to protect our ancestors from getting sick from the spoiled food and contact sick creatures.

It\'s easy to confuse the expression of contempt with a smile. But this asymmetric expression, when the lip corner is pulled up at one side only, has a totally different meaning. This emotion is only experienced concerning people or their actions. It\'s triggered by a feeling of being superior to someone.

string-array.name: Emotion_contempt_cards
string-array.item: Lip corner pulled up and to the back on one side (only unilateral expression)

resources.string: Fear is dealing with a threat of harm. The universal theme of fear is loss of physical support or a threatening object entering into the visual field. Fear prepares us to take care of our being: to freeze and become motionless to avoid a dangerous step and/or become invisible for the potential source of danger or to flee away as fast as possible."
Freeze or move away. Blood rushes down to the legs. Skin gets pale. Stress related hormones such as cortisol, adrenalin and osteocalcin get released.

The trigger for sadness is a loss, which is often irreversible. That makes sadness a long-lasting emotion that may go up till the levels of complete agony, then calm down to the levels of grief, and then rise again.
Loss of a valued person, object, or opportunity
Loss of muscle tone, slack body. Prolonged sadness is associated with decrease of pleasure hormones serotonin and dopamine.
Sore throat, aching and/or watery eyes

Surprise is the most rapid emotion that appears as a reaction to an unexpected event, and it lasts only for a second or two. Its purpose is to draw attention to what you have unexpectedly gotten exposed to, and to allow a quick estimation of its meaning. That is why genuine surprise so quickly fades out and switches to the next emotion that concludes the evaluation.
To focus your attention on the change in the environment
Move backwards. May be only a head or upper body move or even step away.

Happiness is the most intuitive, but also the most sophisticated emotion. The universal trigger for it is pleasure, but what brings us that pleasure can vary and up till now is not very well understood.
Elevated. Depending on type of pleasure serotonin, endorphin, dopamine or oxytocin levels increase.

string-array.name: Emotion_happiness_cards
string-array.item: Lip corners pulled up towards temples
